page.title: 19Local History CONT.
page.content: During the many years this area has been inhabited fact and fancy have become intermixed to give us a wealth of legend. Secret tunnels leading from a prioy to the nunnery across the river. Monks who had given their lives helping others during the plague years being exhumed only to haunt those who dug them up.The ghost of 'Old Mo' who haunts a factory so well no-one will take the night shift.The last hanging to take place in Lowtown was of two rivermen who had killed and partly eaten a foal belonging to a local magistrate. The wild and bawdy life in the Lowtown doss-houses where life was cheap, as was the gin which was served throughout the twenty odd taverns in the area.These old stories, some true, linger on, handed down from one generation to the next.
